availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Julius Fosses (Louisville, Kentucky, aide-de-camp, asst inspector general of cavalry, and Bvt Maj. of Vols. (U.S.A.))

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, soldier. Native of Belgium. Served as brevet major, lieutenant colonel, assistant inspector general of cavalry, and aide de camp of U.S. volunteers from May 1, 1862, to March 13, 1865.

ab.bibl: Francis B. Heitman, Historical Register and Dictionary of the United States Army, from its Organization, September 29, 1789, to March 2, 1903 vol. 1, pt. 3 (Washington, DC: Government Printing Office, 1903), 431.
